thread.title: Rutgers football nearly upset No. 1, national champs Miami in 2002
thread.title_full: Rutgers football nearly upset No. 1, national champs Miami in 2002

author: app.com
title: Rutgers football nearly upset No. 1, national champs Miami in 2002
text:
MORE The photo on the back page of the student newspaper told a better story than the whole truth.
Because Rutgers allowed 28 unanswered fourth-quarter points to Miami on Nov. 2, 2002, there are no images of the home crowd storming the field or of players conducting for fans singing the alma mater.
Just the double-take-worthy sight of the scoreboard showing a one-win Rutgers team leading the defending national champions and top-ranked team in the nation, 17-14, with 14 minutes remaining in what could have been the unlikeliest college football upset of all-time.
“We’re of the mind that we can pull this thing off,” then-Rutgers defensive end Raheem Orr said last week, his words still cut with intensity. “Nobody is expecting us to win. Even some of the guys on the team – not me – were shocked and like, ‘I can’t believe we’re winning.’"
For the first time since that day, Rutgers will host the top-ranked defending national champions when Ohio State visits Piscataway at 8 p.m. Saturday for an ABC national telecast .
